question_stem: The graph of \(y = g(x)\) is shown below. It passes through the points (1, 2), (0, -1) and (3, 4).

parts.question_text: State the coordinates of the points on the graph of \(y = 2g(x)\) corresponding to the points (1, 2), (0, -1) and (3, 4) on the graph of \(y=g(x)\).
parts.solution_text:
The transformation \(y = 2g(x)\) represents a stretch parallel to the y-axis by a scale factor of 2. This means the x-coordinates of the points remain unchanged, while the y-coordinates are multiplied by 2.

Therefore, the point (1, 2) transforms to (1, 4).
The point (0, -1) transforms to (0, -2).
The point (3, 4) transforms to (3, 8).
